modules.description: This module provides glyph metrics for font rendering, including bounding box dimensions and advance width. It works with font glyphs to determine spatial characteristics of individual characters. Concrete use cases include calculating text layout and spacing for rendering text in graphical applications.

This module defines bitwise style flags for text rendering with SDL_ttf, including normal, bold, italic, underline, and strikethrough. It supports combining and testing styles using operations like `+`, `-`, `test`, and `eq`. These styles configure font appearance when loading or rendering text in applications such as game UIs or dynamic text displays.

This module defines the `t` type representing font hinting modes used in text rendering. It includes variants for common hinting strategies like `Normal`, `Light`, `Mono`, and `None`. These values control how glyphs are adjusted for display on pixel grids, directly affecting text clarity and performance in SDL2-based applications.

This module enables loading and rendering TrueType fonts with UTF-8 support, offering text layout, glyph metrics queries, and font style configuration. It works with font objects and SDL surfaces to support features like word wrapping, color blending, and kerning adjustments, with key use cases in game UIs and internationalized text rendering. Submodules provide glyph metrics for layout calculations, bitwise style flags for text appearance, and hinting modes to control glyph rendering on pixel grids. Operations include loading fonts, setting styles, querying glyph dimensions, and rendering text surfaces with precise typographic control.

This module integrates TrueType font handling with SDL, enabling text rendering through font objects and surface generation. It supports UTF-8 encoded strings, word wrapping, color blending, and glyph metric queries for precise layout control. Key operations include loading fonts, configuring styles like bold or italic, and rendering text into SDL surfaces. Example uses include drawing multi-line labels in a game UI or measuring text dimensions for dynamic layout adjustments.
